contents.verseText: So how can you comfort me with empty words? For your answers remain full of falsehood.”
contents: So how can you comfort me with empty words?
For your answers remain full of falsehood.”

s1: Eliphaz: Can a Man Be of Use to God?

contents.verseText: Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:
contents: Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:

contents.verseText: “Can a man be of use to God? Can even a wise man benefit Him?
contents: “Can a man be of use to God?
Can even a wise man benefit Him?

contents.verseText: Does it delight the Almighty that you are righteous? Does He profit if your ways are blameless?
contents: Does it delight the Almighty that you are righteous?
Does He profit if your ways are blameless?

contents.verseText: Is it for your reverence that He rebukes you and enters into judgment against you?
contents: Is it for your reverence that He rebukes you
and enters into judgment against you?

contents.verseText: Is not your wickedness great? Are not your iniquities endless?
contents: Is not your wickedness great?
Are not your iniquities endless?

contents.verseText: For you needlessly demanded security from your brothers and deprived the naked of their clothing.
contents: For you needlessly demanded security from your brothers
and deprived the naked of their clothing.

contents.verseText: You gave no water to the weary and withheld food from the famished,
contents: You gave no water to the weary
and withheld food from the famished,

contents.verseText: while the land belonged to a mighty man, and a man of honor lived on it.
contents: while the land belonged to a mighty man,
and a man of honor lived on it.

contents.verseText: You sent widows away empty-handed, and the strength of the fatherless was crushed.
contents: You sent widows away empty-handed,
and the strength of the fatherless was crushed.

contents.verseText: Therefore snares surround you, and sudden peril terrifies you;
contents: Therefore snares surround you,
and sudden peril terrifies you;

contents.verseText: it is so dark you cannot see, and a flood of water covers you.
contents: it is so dark you cannot see,
and a flood of water covers you.

contents.verseText: Is not God as high as the heavens? Look at the highest stars, how lofty they are!
contents: Is not God as high as the heavens?
Look at the highest stars, how lofty they are!

contents.verseText: Yet you say: ‘What does God know? Does He judge through thick darkness?
contents: Yet you say: ‘What does God know?
Does He judge through thick darkness?

contents.verseText: Thick clouds veil Him so He does not see us as He traverses the vault of heaven. ’
contents: Thick clouds veil Him so He does not see us
as He traverses the vault of heaven.

footnote.ft: Or heaven’s horizon or the circle of the sky

contents.verseText: Will you stay on the ancient path that wicked men have trod?
contents: Will you stay on the ancient path
that wicked men have trod?

contents.verseText: They were snatched away before their time, and their foundations were swept away by a flood.
contents: They were snatched away before their time,
and their foundations were swept away by a flood.

contents.verseText: They said to God, ‘Depart from us. What can the Almighty do to us?’
contents: They said to God, ‘Depart from us.
What can the Almighty do to us?’

contents.verseText: But it was He who filled their houses with good things; so I stay far from the counsel of the wicked.
contents: But it was He who filled their houses with good things;
so I stay far from the counsel of the wicked.

contents.verseText: The righteous see it and are glad; the innocent mock them:
contents: The righteous see it and are glad;
the innocent mock them:

contents.verseText: ‘Surely our foes are destroyed, and fire has consumed their excess.’
contents: ‘Surely our foes are destroyed,
and fire has consumed their excess.’

contents.verseText: Reconcile now and be at peace with Him; thereby good will come to you.
contents: Reconcile now and be at peace with Him;
thereby good will come to you.

contents.verseText: Receive instruction from His mouth, and lay up His words in your heart.
contents: Receive instruction from His mouth,
and lay up His words in your heart.

contents.verseText: If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored. If you remove injustice from your tents
contents: If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored.
If you remove injustice from your tents

contents.verseText: and consign your gold to the dust and the gold of Ophir to the stones of the ravines,
contents: and consign your gold to the dust
and the gold of Ophir to the stones of the ravines,

contents.verseText: then the Almighty will be your gold and the finest silver for you.
contents: then the Almighty will be your gold
and the finest silver for you.

contents.verseText: Surely then you will delight in the Almighty and lift up your face to God.
contents: Surely then you will delight in the Almighty
and lift up your face to God.

contents.verseText: You will pray to Him, and He will hear you, and you will fulfill your vows.
contents: You will pray to Him, and He will hear you,
and you will fulfill your vows.

contents.verseText: Your decisions will be carried out, and light will shine on your ways.
contents: Your decisions will be carried out,
and light will shine on your ways.

contents.verseText: When men are brought low and you say, ‘Lift them up!’ then He will save the lowly.
contents: When men are brought low and you say, ‘Lift them up!’
then He will save the lowly.

contents.verseText: He will deliver even one who is not innocent, rescuing him through the cleanness of your hands.”
contents: He will deliver even one who is not innocent,
rescuing him through the cleanness of your hands.”

contents.verseText: Then Job answered:
contents: Then Job answered:

contents.verseText: “Even today my complaint is bitter. His hand is heavy despite my groaning.
contents: “Even today my complaint is bitter.
His hand is heavy despite my groaning.

contents.verseText: If only I knew where to find Him, so that I could go to His seat.
contents: If only I knew where to find Him,
so that I could go to His seat.

contents.verseText: I would plead my case before Him and fill my mouth with arguments.
contents: I would plead my case before Him
and fill my mouth with arguments.

contents.verseText: I would learn how He would answer, and consider what He would say.
contents: I would learn how He would answer,
and consider what He would say.

contents.verseText: Would He contend with me in His great power? No, He would certainly take note of me.
contents: Would He contend with me in His great power?
No, He would certainly take note of me.

contents.verseText: Then an upright man could reason with Him, and I would be delivered forever from my Judge.
contents: Then an upright man could reason with Him,
and I would be delivered forever from my Judge.

contents.verseText: If I go east, He is not there, and if I go west, I cannot find Him.
contents: If I go east, He is not there,
and if I go west, I cannot find Him.

contents.verseText: When He is at work in the north, I cannot behold Him; when He turns to the south, I cannot see Him.
contents: When He is at work in the north, I cannot behold Him;
when He turns to the south, I cannot see Him.

contents.verseText: Yet He knows the way I have taken; when He has tested me, I will come forth as gold.
contents: Yet He knows the way I have taken;
when He has tested me, I will come forth as gold.

contents.verseText: My feet have followed in His tracks; I have kept His way without turning aside.
contents: My feet have followed in His tracks;
I have kept His way without turning aside.

contents.verseText: I have not departed from the command of His lips; I have treasured the words of His mouth more than my daily bread.
contents: I have not departed from the command of His lips;
I have treasured the words of His mouth
more than my daily bread.

contents.verseText: But He is unchangeable, and who can oppose Him? He does what He desires.
contents: But He is unchangeable, and who can oppose Him?
He does what He desires.

contents.verseText: For He carries out His decree against me, and He has many such plans.
contents: For He carries out His decree against me,
and He has many such plans.

contents.verseText: Therefore I am terrified in His presence; when I consider this, I fear Him.
contents: Therefore I am terrified in His presence;
when I consider this, I fear Him.

contents.verseText: God has made my heart faint; the Almighty has terrified me.
contents: God has made my heart faint;
the Almighty has terrified me.

contents.verseText: Yet I am not silenced by the darkness, by the thick darkness that covers my face.
contents: Yet I am not silenced by the darkness,
by the thick darkness that covers my face.

contents.verseText: “Why does the Almighty not reserve times for judgment? Why may those who know Him never see His days?
contents: “Why does the Almighty not reserve times for judgment?
Why may those who know Him never see His days?

contents.verseText: Men move boundary stones; they pasture stolen flocks.
contents: Men move boundary stones;
they pasture stolen flocks.

contents.verseText: They drive away the donkey of the fatherless and take the widow’s ox in pledge.
contents: They drive away the donkey of the fatherless
and take the widow’s ox in pledge.

contents.verseText: They push the needy off the road and force all the poor of the land into hiding.
contents: They push the needy off the road
and force all the poor of the land into hiding.

contents.verseText: Indeed, like wild donkeys in the desert, the poor go to work foraging for food; the wasteland is food for their children.
contents: Indeed, like wild donkeys in the desert,
the poor go to work foraging for food;
the wasteland is food for their children.

contents.verseText: They gather fodder in the fields and glean the vineyards of the wicked.
contents: They gather fodder in the fields
and glean the vineyards of the wicked.

contents.verseText: Without clothing, they spend the night naked; they have no covering against the cold.
contents: Without clothing, they spend the night naked;
they have no covering against the cold.

contents.verseText: Drenched by mountain rains, they huddle against the rocks for want of shelter.
contents: Drenched by mountain rains,
they huddle against the rocks for want of shelter.

contents.verseText: The fatherless infant is snatched from the breast; the nursing child of the poor is seized for a debt.
contents: The fatherless infant is snatched from the breast;
the nursing child of the poor is seized for a debt.

contents.verseText: Without clothing, they wander about naked. They carry the sheaves, but still go hungry.
contents: Without clothing, they wander about naked.
They carry the sheaves, but still go hungry.

contents.verseText: They crush olives within their walls; they tread the winepresses, but go thirsty.
contents: They crush olives within their walls;
they tread the winepresses, but go thirsty.

contents.verseText: From the city, men groan, and the souls of the wounded cry out, yet God charges no one with wrongdoing.
contents: From the city, men groan,
and the souls of the wounded cry out,
yet God charges no one with wrongdoing.

contents.verseText: Then there are those who rebel against the light, not knowing its ways or staying on its paths.
contents: Then there are those who rebel against the light,
not knowing its ways or staying on its paths.

contents.verseText: When daylight is gone, the murderer rises to kill the poor and needy; in the night he is like a thief.
contents: When daylight is gone, the murderer rises
to kill the poor and needy;
in the night he is like a thief.

contents.verseText: The eye of the adulterer watches for twilight. Thinking, ‘No eye will see me,’ he covers his face.
contents: The eye of the adulterer watches for twilight.
Thinking, ‘No eye will see me,’ he covers his face.

contents.verseText: In the dark they dig through houses; by day they shut themselves in, never to experience the light.
contents: In the dark they dig through houses;
by day they shut themselves in,
never to experience the light.

contents.verseText: For to them, deep darkness is their morning; surely they are friends with the terrors of darkness!
contents: For to them, deep darkness is their morning;
surely they are friends with the terrors of darkness!

contents.verseText: They are but foam on the surface of the water; their portion of the land is cursed, so that no one turns toward their vineyards.
contents: They are but foam on the surface of the water;
their portion of the land is cursed,
so that no one turns toward their vineyards.

contents.verseText: As drought and heat consume the melting snow, so Sheol steals those who have sinned.
contents: As drought and heat consume the melting snow,
so Sheol steals those who have sinned.

contents.verseText: The womb forgets them; the worm feeds on them; they are remembered no more. So injustice is like a broken tree.
contents: The womb forgets them;
the worm feeds on them;
they are remembered no more.
So injustice is like a broken tree.

contents.verseText: They prey on the barren and childless, and show no kindness to the widow.
contents: They prey on the barren and childless,
and show no kindness to the widow.

contents.verseText: Yet by His power, God drags away the mighty; though rising up, they have no assurance of life.
contents: Yet by His power, God drags away the mighty;
though rising up, they have no assurance of life.

contents.verseText: He gives them a sense of security, but His eyes are on their ways.
contents: He gives them a sense of security,
but His eyes are on their ways.

contents.verseText: They are exalted for a moment, then they are gone; they are brought low and gathered up like all others; they are cut off like heads of grain.
contents: They are exalted for a moment,
then they are gone;
they are brought low and gathered up like all others;
they are cut off like heads of grain.

contents.verseText: If this is not so, then who can prove me a liar and reduce my words to nothing?”
contents: If this is not so, then who can prove me a liar
and reduce my words to nothing?”

contents.verseText: Then Bildad the Shuhite replied:
contents: Then Bildad the Shuhite replied:

contents.verseText: “Dominion and awe belong to God; He establishes harmony in the heights of heaven.
contents: “Dominion and awe belong to God;
He establishes harmony in the heights of heaven.

contents.verseText: Can His troops be numbered? On whom does His light not rise?
contents: Can His troops be numbered?
On whom does His light not rise?

contents.verseText: How then can a man be just before God? How can one born of woman be pure?
contents: How then can a man be just before God?
How can one born of woman be pure?

contents.verseText: If even the moon does not shine, and the stars are not pure in His sight,
contents: If even the moon does not shine,
and the stars are not pure in His sight,

contents.verseText: how much less man, who is but a maggot, and the son of man, who is but a worm!”
contents: how much less man, who is but a maggot,
and the son of man, who is but a worm!”

s1: Job: Who Can Understand God’s Majesty?

contents.verseText: Then Job answered:
contents: Then Job answered:

contents.verseText: “How you have helped the powerless and saved the arm that is feeble!
contents: “How you have helped the powerless
and saved the arm that is feeble!

contents.verseText: How you have counseled the unwise and provided fully sound insight!
contents: How you have counseled the unwise
and provided fully sound insight!

contents.verseText: To whom have you uttered these words? And whose spirit spoke through you?
contents: To whom have you uttered these words?
And whose spirit spoke through you?

contents.verseText: The dead tremble—those beneath the waters and those who dwell in them.
contents: The dead tremble—
those beneath the waters and those who dwell in them.

contents.verseText: Sheol is naked before God, and Abaddon has no covering.
contents: Sheol is naked before God,
and Abaddon
has no covering.

contents.verseText: He stretches out the north over empty space; He hangs the earth upon nothing.
contents: He stretches out the north over empty space;
He hangs the earth upon nothing.

contents.verseText: He wraps up the waters in His clouds, yet the clouds do not burst under their own weight.
contents: He wraps up the waters in His clouds,
yet the clouds do not burst under their own weight.

contents.verseText: He covers the face of the full moon, spreading over it His cloud.
contents: He covers the face of the full moon,
spreading over it His cloud.

contents.verseText: He has inscribed a horizon on the face of the waters at the boundary between light and darkness.
contents: He has inscribed a horizon on the face of the waters
at the boundary between light and darkness.

contents.verseText: The foundations of heaven quake, astounded at His rebuke.
contents: The foundations of heaven quake,
astounded at His rebuke.

contents.verseText: By His power He stirred the sea; by His understanding He shattered Rahab.
contents: By His power He stirred
the sea;
by His understanding He shattered Rahab.

contents.verseText: By His breath the skies were cleared; His hand pierced the fleeing serpent.
contents: By His breath the skies were cleared;
His hand pierced the fleeing serpent.

footnote.ft: Hebrew nachash; translated in most cases as snake

contents.verseText: Indeed, these are but the fringes of His ways; how faint is the whisper we hear of Him! Who then can understand the thunder of His power?”
contents: Indeed, these are but the fringes of His ways;
how faint is the whisper we hear of Him!
Who then can understand
the thunder of His power?”

contents.verseText: Job continued his discourse:
contents: Job continued his discourse:

contents.verseText: “As surely as God lives, who has deprived me of justice—the Almighty, who has embittered my soul—
contents: “As surely as God lives, who has deprived me of justice—
the Almighty, who has embittered my soul—

contents.verseText: as long as my breath is still within me and the breath of God remains in my nostrils,
contents: as long as my breath is still within me
and the breath of God remains in my nostrils,

contents.verseText: my lips will not speak wickedness, and my tongue will not utter deceit.
contents: my lips will not speak wickedness,
and my tongue will not utter deceit.

contents.verseText: I will never say that you are right; I will maintain my integrity until I die.
contents: I will never say that you are right;
I will maintain my integrity until I die.

contents.verseText: I will cling to my righteousness and never let go. As long as I live, my conscience will not accuse me.
contents: I will cling to my righteousness and never let go.
As long as I live, my conscience will not accuse me.

contents.verseText: May my enemy be like the wicked and my opponent like the unjust.
contents: May my enemy be like the wicked
and my opponent like the unjust.

contents.verseText: For what is the hope of the godless when he is cut off, when God takes away his life?
contents: For what is the hope of the godless when he is cut off,
when God takes away his life?

contents.verseText: Will God hear his cry when distress comes upon him?
contents: Will God hear his cry
when distress comes upon him?

contents.verseText: Will he delight in the Almighty? Will he call upon God at all times?
contents: Will he delight in the Almighty?
Will he call upon God at all times?

contents.verseText: I will instruct you in the power of God. I will not conceal the ways of the Almighty.
contents: I will instruct you in the power of God.
I will not conceal the ways of the Almighty.

contents.verseText: Surely all of you have seen it for yourselves. Why then do you keep up this empty talk?
contents: Surely all of you have seen it for yourselves.
Why then do you keep up this empty talk?

contents.verseText: This is the wicked man’s portion from God—the heritage the ruthless receive from the Almighty.
contents: This is the wicked man’s portion from God—
the heritage the ruthless receive from the Almighty.

contents.verseText: Though his sons are many, they are destined for the sword; and his offspring will never have enough food.
contents: Though his sons are many, they are destined for the sword;
and his offspring will never have enough food.

contents.verseText: His survivors will be buried by the plague, and their widows will not weep for them.
contents: His survivors will be buried by the plague,
and their widows will not weep for them.

contents.verseText: Though he heaps up silver like dust and piles up a wardrobe like clay,
contents: Though he heaps up silver like dust
and piles up a wardrobe like clay,

contents.verseText: what he lays up, the righteous will wear, and his silver will be divided by the innocent.
contents: what he lays up, the righteous will wear,
and his silver will be divided by the innocent.

contents.verseText: The house he built is like a moth’s cocoon, like a hut set up by a watchman.
contents: The house he built is like a moth’s cocoon,
like a hut set up by a watchman.

contents.verseText: He lies down wealthy, but will do so no more; when he opens his eyes, all is gone.
contents: He lies down wealthy, but will do so no more;
when he opens his eyes, all is gone.

contents.verseText: Terrors overtake him like a flood; a tempest sweeps him away in the night.
contents: Terrors overtake him like a flood;
a tempest sweeps him away in the night.

contents.verseText: The east wind carries him away, and he is gone; it sweeps him out of his place.
contents: The east wind carries him away, and he is gone;
it sweeps him out of his place.

contents.verseText: It hurls itself against him without mercy as he flees headlong from its power.
contents: It hurls itself against him without mercy
as he flees headlong from its power.

contents.verseText: It claps its hands at him and hisses him out of his place.
contents: It claps its hands at him
and hisses him out of his place.

contents.verseText: “Surely there is a mine for silver and a place where gold is refined.
contents: “Surely there is a mine for silver
and a place where gold is refined.

contents.verseText: Iron is taken from the earth, and copper is smelted from ore.
contents: Iron is taken from the earth,
and copper is smelted from ore.

contents.verseText: Man puts an end to the darkness; he probes the farthest recesses for ore in deepest darkness.
contents: Man puts an end to the darkness;
he probes the farthest recesses
for ore in deepest darkness.

contents.verseText: Far from human habitation he cuts a shaft in places forgotten by the foot of man. Far from men he dangles and sways.
contents: Far from human habitation he cuts a shaft
in places forgotten by the foot of man.
Far from men he dangles and sways.

contents.verseText: Food may come from the earth, but from below it is transformed as by fire.
contents: Food may come from the earth,
but from below it is transformed as by fire.

contents.verseText: Its rocks are the source of sapphires, containing flecks of gold.
contents: Its rocks are the source of sapphires,
containing flecks of gold.

contents.verseText: No bird of prey knows that path; no falcon’s eye has seen it.
contents: No bird of prey knows that path;
no falcon’s eye has seen it.

contents.verseText: Proud beasts have never trodden it; no lion has ever prowled over it.
contents: Proud beasts have never trodden it;
no lion has ever prowled over it.

contents.verseText: The miner strikes the flint; he overturns mountains at their base.
contents: The miner strikes the flint;
he overturns mountains at their base.

contents.verseText: He hews out channels in the rocks, and his eyes spot every treasure.
contents: He hews out channels in the rocks,
and his eyes spot every treasure.

contents.verseText: He stops up the sources of the streams to bring what is hidden to light.
contents: He stops up

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX and Vulgate He searches

contents: the sources of the streams
to bring what is hidden to light.

contents.verseText: But where can wisdom be found, and where does understanding dwell?
contents: But where can wisdom be found,
and where does understanding dwell?

contents.verseText: No man can know its value, nor is it found in the land of the living.
contents: No man can know its value,
nor is it found in the land of the living.

contents.verseText: The ocean depths say, ‘It is not in me,’ while the sea declares, ‘It is not with me.’
contents: The ocean depths say, ‘It is not in me,’
while the sea declares, ‘It is not with me.’

contents.verseText: It cannot be bought with gold, nor can its price be weighed out in silver.
contents: It cannot be bought with gold,
nor can its price be weighed out in silver.

contents.verseText: It cannot be valued in the gold of Ophir, in precious onyx or sapphire.
contents: It cannot be valued in the gold of Ophir,
in precious onyx or sapphire.

contents.verseText: Neither gold nor crystal can compare to it, nor jewels of fine gold be exchanged for it.
contents: Neither gold nor crystal can compare to it,
nor jewels of fine gold be exchanged for it.

contents.verseText: Coral and quartz are unworthy of mention; the price of wisdom is beyond rubies.
contents: Coral and quartz are unworthy of mention;
the price of wisdom is beyond rubies.

contents.verseText: Topaz from Cush cannot compare to it, nor can it be valued in pure gold.
contents: Topaz from Cush

footnote.ft: That is, the upper Nile region

contents: cannot compare to it,
nor can it be valued in pure gold.

contents.verseText: From where then does wisdom come, and where does understanding dwell?
contents: From where then does wisdom come,
and where does understanding dwell?

contents.verseText: It is hidden from the eyes of every living thing and concealed from the birds of the air.
contents: It is hidden from the eyes of every living thing
and concealed from the birds of the air.

contents.verseText: Abaddon and Death say, ‘We have heard a rumor about it.’
contents: Abaddon
and Death say,
‘We have heard a rumor about it.’

contents.verseText: But God understands its way, and He knows its place.
contents: But God understands its way,
and He knows its place.

contents.verseText: For He looks to the ends of the earth and sees everything under the heavens.
contents: For He looks to the ends of the earth
and sees everything under the heavens.

contents.verseText: When God fixed the weight of the wind and measured out the waters,
contents: When God fixed the weight of the wind
and measured out the waters,

contents.verseText: when He set a limit for the rain and a path for the thunderbolt,
contents: when He set a limit for the rain
and a path for the thunderbolt,

contents.verseText: then He looked at wisdom and appraised it; He established it and searched it out.
contents: then He looked at wisdom and appraised it;
He established it and searched it out.

contents.verseText: And He said to man, ‘Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom, and to turn away from evil is understanding.’”
contents: And He said to man, ‘Behold,
the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom,
and to turn away from evil is understanding.’”

contents.verseText: And Job continued his discourse:
contents: And Job continued his discourse:

contents.verseText: “How I long for the months gone by, for the days when God watched over me,
contents: “How I long for the months gone by,
for the days when God watched over me,

contents.verseText: when His lamp shone above my head, and by His light I walked through the darkness,
contents: when His lamp shone above my head,
and by His light I walked through the darkness,

contents.verseText: when I was in my prime, when the friendship of God rested on my tent,
contents: when I was in my prime,

footnote.ft: Hebrew in the time of my harvest

contents: when the friendship of God rested on my tent,

contents.verseText: when the Almighty was still with me and my children were around me,
contents: when the Almighty was still with me
and my children were around me,

contents.verseText: when my steps were bathed in cream and the rock poured out for me streams of oil!
contents: when my steps were bathed in cream
and the rock poured out for me streams of oil!

contents.verseText: When I went out to the city gate and took my seat in the public square,
contents: When I went out to the city gate
and took my seat in the public square,

contents.verseText: the young men saw me and withdrew, and the old men rose to their feet.
contents: the young men saw me and withdrew,
and the old men rose to their feet.

contents.verseText: The princes refrained from speaking and covered their mouths with their hands.
contents: The princes refrained from speaking
and covered their mouths with their hands.

contents.verseText: The voices of the nobles were hushed, and their tongues stuck to the roofs of their mouths.
contents: The voices of the nobles were hushed,
and their tongues stuck to the roofs of their mouths.

contents.verseText: For those who heard me called me blessed, and those who saw me commended me,
contents: For those who heard me called me blessed,
and those who saw me commended me,

contents.verseText: because I rescued the poor who cried out and the fatherless who had no helper.
contents: because I rescued the poor who cried out
and the fatherless who had no helper.

contents.verseText: The dying man blessed me, and I made the widow’s heart sing for joy.
contents: The dying man blessed me,
and I made the widow’s heart sing for joy.

contents.verseText: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me; justice was my robe and my turban.
contents: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me;
justice was my robe and my turban.

contents.verseText: I served as eyes to the blind and as feet to the lame.
contents: I served as eyes to the blind
and as feet to the lame.

contents.verseText: I was a father to the needy, and I took up the case of the stranger.
contents: I was a father to the needy,
and I took up the case of the stranger.

contents.verseText: I shattered the fangs of the unjust and snatched the prey from his teeth.
contents: I shattered the fangs of the unjust
and snatched the prey from his teeth.

contents.verseText: So I thought: ‘I will die in my nest and multiply my days as the sand.
contents: So I thought: ‘I will die in my nest
and multiply my days as the sand.

contents.verseText: My roots will spread out to the waters, and the dew will rest nightly on my branches.
contents: My roots will spread out to the waters,
and the dew will rest nightly on my branches.

contents.verseText: My glory is ever new within me, and my bow is renewed in my hand.’
contents: My glory is ever new within me,
and my bow is renewed in my hand.’

contents.verseText: Men listened to me with expectation, waiting silently for my counsel.
contents: Men listened to me with expectation,
waiting silently for my counsel.

contents.verseText: After my words, they spoke no more; my speech settled on them like dew.
contents: After my words, they spoke no more;
my speech settled on them like dew.

contents.verseText: They waited for me as for rain and drank in my words like spring showers.
contents: They waited for me as for rain
and drank in my words like spring showers.

contents.verseText: If I smiled at them, they did not believe it; the light of my countenance was precious.
contents: If I smiled at them, they did not believe it;
the light of my countenance was precious.

contents.verseText: I chose their course and presided as chief. So I dwelt as a king among his troops, as a comforter of the mourners.
contents: I chose their course and presided as chief.
So I dwelt as a king among his troops,
as a comforter of the mourners.

contents.verseText: “But now they mock me, men younger than I am, whose fathers I would have refused to entrust with my sheep dogs.
contents: “But now they mock me,
men younger than I am,
whose fathers I would have refused
to entrust with my sheep dogs.

contents.verseText: What use to me was the strength of their hands, since their vigor had left them?
contents: What use to me was the strength of their hands,
since their vigor had left them?

contents.verseText: Gaunt from poverty and hunger, they gnawed the dry land, and the desolate wasteland by night.
contents: Gaunt from poverty and hunger,
they gnawed the dry land,
and the desolate wasteland by night.

contents.verseText: They plucked mallow among the shrubs, and the roots of the broom tree were their food.
contents: They plucked mallow among the shrubs,
and the roots of the broom tree were their food.

contents.verseText: They were banished from among men, shouted down like thieves,
contents: They were banished from among men,
shouted down like thieves,

contents.verseText: so that they lived on the slopes of the wadis, among the rocks and in holes in the ground.
contents: so that they lived on the slopes of the wadis,
among the rocks and in holes in the ground.

contents.verseText: They cried out among the shrubs and huddled beneath the nettles.
contents: They cried out among the shrubs
and huddled beneath the nettles.

contents.verseText: A senseless and nameless brood, they were driven off the land.
contents: A senseless and nameless brood,
they were driven off the land.

contents.verseText: And now they mock me in song; I have become a byword among them.
contents: And now they mock me in song;
I have become a byword among them.

contents.verseText: They abhor me and keep far from me; they do not hesitate to spit in my face.
contents: They abhor me and keep far from me;
they do not hesitate to spit in my face.

contents.verseText: Because God has unstrung my bow and afflicted me, they have cast off restraint in my presence.
contents: Because God has unstrung my bow and afflicted me,
they have cast off restraint
in my presence.

contents.verseText: The rabble arises at my right; they lay snares for my feet and build siege ramps against me.
contents: The rabble arises at my right;
they lay snares for my feet
and build siege ramps against me.

contents.verseText: They tear up my path; they profit from my destruction, with no one to restrain them.
contents: They tear up my path;
they profit from my destruction,
with no one to restrain them.

footnote.ft: Or with no one to assist them

contents.verseText: They advance as through a wide breach; through the ruins they keep rolling in.
contents: They advance as through a wide breach;
through the ruins they keep rolling in.

contents.verseText: Terrors are turned loose against me; they drive away my dignity as by the wind, and my prosperity has passed like a cloud.
contents: Terrors are turned loose against me;
they drive away my dignity as by the wind,
and my prosperity has passed like a cloud.

contents.verseText: And now my soul is poured out within me; days of affliction grip me.
contents: And now my soul is poured out within me;
days of affliction grip me.

contents.verseText: Night pierces my bones, and my gnawing pains never rest.
contents: Night pierces my bones,
and my gnawing pains never rest.

contents.verseText: With great force He grasps my garment; He seizes me by the collar of my tunic.
contents: With great force He grasps my garment;

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew He becomes like a garment to me or my garment is disfigured

contents: He seizes me by the collar of my tunic.

contents.verseText: He throws me into the mud, and I have become like dust and ashes.
contents: He throws me into the mud,
and I have become like dust and ashes.

contents.verseText: I cry out to You for help, but You do not answer; when I stand up, You merely look at me.
contents: I cry out to You for help, but You do not answer;
when I stand up, You merely look at me.

contents.verseText: You have ruthlessly turned on me; You oppose me with Your strong hand.
contents: You have ruthlessly turned on me;
You oppose me with Your strong hand.

contents.verseText: You snatch me up into the wind and drive me before it; You toss me about in the storm.
contents: You snatch me up into the wind
and drive me before it;
You toss me about
in the storm.

contents.verseText: Yes, I know that You will bring me down to death, to the place appointed for all the living.
contents: Yes, I know that You will bring me down to death,
to the place appointed for all the living.

contents.verseText: Yet no one stretches out his hand to a ruined man when he cries for help in his distress.
contents: Yet no one stretches out his hand to a ruined man
when he cries for help in his distress.

contents.verseText: Have I not wept for those in trouble? Has my soul not grieved for the needy?
contents: Have I not wept for those in trouble?
Has my soul not grieved for the needy?

contents.verseText: But when I hoped for good, evil came; when I looked for light, darkness fell.
contents: But when I hoped for good, evil came;
when I looked for light, darkness fell.

contents.verseText: I am churning within and cannot rest; days of affliction confront me.
contents: I am churning within and cannot rest;
days of affliction confront me.

contents.verseText: I go about blackened, but not by the sun. I stand up in the assembly and cry for help.
contents: I go about blackened, but not by the sun.
I stand up in the assembly and cry for help.

contents.verseText: I have become a brother of jackals, a companion of ostriches.
contents: I have become a brother of jackals,
a companion of ostriches.

footnote.ft: Literally of daughters of an ostrich or of daughters of an owl

contents.verseText: My skin grows black and peels, and my bones burn with fever.
contents: My skin grows black and peels,
and my bones burn with fever.

contents.verseText: My harp is tuned to mourning and my flute to the sound of weeping.
contents: My harp is tuned to mourning
and my flute to the sound of weeping.

contents.verseText: “I have made a covenant with my eyes. How then could I gaze with desire at a virgin?
contents: “I have made a covenant with my eyes.
How then could I gaze with desire at a virgin?

contents.verseText: For what is the allotment of God from above, or the heritage from the Almighty on high?
contents: For what is the allotment of God from above,
or the heritage from the Almighty on high?

contents.verseText: Does not disaster come to the unjust and calamity to the workers of iniquity?
contents: Does not disaster come to the unjust
and calamity to the workers of iniquity?

contents.verseText: Does He not see my ways and count my every step?
contents: Does He not see my ways
and count my every step?

contents.verseText: If I have walked in falsehood or my foot has rushed to deceit,
contents: If I have walked in falsehood
or my foot has rushed to deceit,

contents.verseText: let God weigh me with honest scales, that He may know my integrity.
contents: let God weigh me with honest scales,
that He may know my integrity.

contents.verseText: If my steps have turned from the path, if my heart has followed my eyes, or if impurity has stuck to my hands,
contents: If my steps have turned from the path,
if my heart has followed my eyes,
or if impurity has stuck to my hands,

contents.verseText: then may another eat what I have sown, and may my crops be uprooted.
contents: then may another eat what I have sown,
and may my crops be uprooted.

contents.verseText: If my heart has been enticed by my neighbor’s wife, or I have lurked at his door,
contents: If my heart has been enticed by my neighbor’s wife,
or I have lurked at his door,

contents.verseText: then may my own wife grind grain for another, and may other men sleep with her.
contents: then may my own wife grind grain for another,
and may other men sleep with her.

contents.verseText: For that would be a heinous crime, an iniquity to be judged.
contents: For that would be a heinous crime,
an iniquity to be judged.

contents.verseText: For it is a fire that burns down to Abaddon; it would root out my entire harvest.
contents: For it is a fire that burns down to Abaddon;
it would root out my entire harvest.

contents.verseText: If I have rejected the cause of my manservant or maidservant when they made a complaint against me,
contents: If I have rejected the cause of my manservant or maidservant
when they made a complaint against me,

contents.verseText: what will I do when God rises to judge? How will I answer when called to account?
contents: what will I do when God rises to judge?
How will I answer when called to account?

contents.verseText: Did not He who made me in the womb also make them? Did not the same One form us in the womb?
contents: Did not He who made me in the womb also make them?
Did not the same One form us in the womb?

contents.verseText: If I have denied the desires of the poor or allowed the widow’s eyes to fail,
contents: If I have denied the desires of the poor
or allowed the widow’s eyes to fail,

contents.verseText: if I have eaten my morsel alone, not sharing it with the fatherless—
contents: if I have eaten my morsel alone,
not sharing it with the fatherless—

contents.verseText: though from my youth I reared him as would a father, and from my mother’s womb I guided the widow—
contents: though from my youth I reared him as would a father,
and from my mother’s womb I guided the widow—

contents.verseText: if I have seen one perish for lack of clothing, or a needy man without a cloak,
contents: if I have seen one perish for lack of clothing,
or a needy man without a cloak,

contents.verseText: if his heart has not blessed me for warming him with the fleece of my sheep,
contents: if his heart has not blessed me

footnote.ft: Hebrew if his loins have not blessed me

contents: for warming him with the fleece of my sheep,

contents.verseText: if I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless because I saw that I had support in the gate,
contents: if I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless
because I saw that I had support in the gate,

contents.verseText: then may my arm fall from my shoulder and be torn from its socket.
contents: then may my arm fall from my shoulder
and be torn from its socket.

contents.verseText: For calamity from God terrifies me, and His splendor I cannot overpower.
contents: For calamity from God terrifies me,
and His splendor I cannot overpower.

contents.verseText: If I have put my trust in gold or called pure gold my security,
contents: If I have put my trust in gold
or called pure gold my security,

contents.verseText: if I have rejoiced in my great wealth because my hand had gained so much,
contents: if I have rejoiced in my great wealth
because my hand had gained so much,

contents.verseText: if I have beheld the sun in its radiance or the moon moving in splendor,
contents: if I have beheld the sun
in its radiance
or the moon moving in splendor,

contents.verseText: so that my heart was secretly enticed and my hand threw a kiss from my mouth,
contents: so that my heart was secretly enticed
and my hand threw a kiss from my mouth,

contents.verseText: this would also be an iniquity to be judged, for I would have denied God on high.
contents: this would also be an iniquity to be judged,
for I would have denied God on high.

contents.verseText: If I have rejoiced in my enemy’s ruin, or exulted when evil befell him—
contents: If I have rejoiced in my enemy’s ruin,
or exulted when evil befell him—

contents.verseText: I have not allowed my mouth to sin by asking for his life with a curse—
contents: I have not allowed my mouth to sin
by asking for his life with a curse—

contents.verseText: if the men of my house have not said, ‘Who is there who has not had his fill?’—
contents: if the men of my house have not said,
‘Who is there who has not had his fill?’—

contents.verseText: but no stranger had to lodge on the street, for my door has been open to the traveler—
contents: but no stranger had to lodge on the street,
for my door has been open to the traveler—

contents.verseText: if I have covered my transgressions like Adam by hiding my guilt in my heart,
contents: if I have covered my transgressions like Adam
by hiding my guilt in my heart,

contents.verseText: because I greatly feared the crowds and the contempt of the clans terrified me, so that I kept silent and would not go outside—
contents: because I greatly feared the crowds
and the contempt of the clans terrified me,
so that I kept silent
and would not go outside—

contents.verseText: (Oh, that I had one to hear me! Here is my signature. Let the Almighty answer me; let my accuser compose an indictment.
contents: (Oh, that I had one to hear me!
Here is my signature.
Let the Almighty answer me;
let my accuser compose an indictment.

contents.verseText: Surely I would carry it on my shoulder and wear it like a crown.
contents: Surely I would carry it on my shoulder
and wear it like a crown.

contents.verseText: I would give account of all my steps; I would approach Him like a prince.)—
contents: I would give account of all my steps;
I would approach Him like a prince.)—

contents.verseText: if my land cries out against me and its furrows weep together,
contents: if my land cries out against me
and its furrows weep together,

contents.verseText: if I have devoured its produce without payment or broken the spirit of its tenants,
contents: if I have devoured its produce without payment
or broken the spirit of its tenants,

contents.verseText: then let briers grow instead of wheat and stinkweed instead of barley.” Thus conclude the words of Job.
contents: then let briers grow instead of wheat
and stinkweed instead of barley.”
Thus conclude the words of Job.

contents.verseText: So these three men stopped answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
contents: So these three men stopped answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

contents.verseText: This kindled the anger of Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram. He burned with anger against Job for justifying himself rather than God,
contents: This kindled the anger of Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram. He burned with anger against Job for justifying himself rather than God,

contents.verseText: and he burned with anger against Job’s three friends because they had failed to refute Job, and yet had condemned him.
contents: and he burned with anger against Job’s three friends because they had failed to refute Job, and yet had condemned him.

contents.verseText: Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because the others were older than he.
contents: Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because the others were older than he.

contents.verseText: But when he saw that the three men had no further reply, his anger was kindled.
contents: But when he saw that the three men had no further reply, his anger was kindled.

contents.verseText: So Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite declared: “I am young in years, while you are old; that is why I was timid and afraid to tell you what I know.
contents: So Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite declared:
“I am young in years,
while you are old;
that is why I was timid and afraid
to tell you what I know.

contents.verseText: I thought that age should speak, and many years should teach wisdom.
contents: I thought that age should speak,
and many years should teach wisdom.

contents.verseText: But there is a spirit in a man, the breath of the Almighty, that gives him understanding.
contents: But there is a spirit

footnote.ft: Or the Spirit; also in verse 18

contents: in a man,
the breath of the Almighty,
that gives him understanding.

contents.verseText: It is not only the old who are wise, or the elderly who understand justice.
contents: It is not only the old
who are wise,
or the elderly who understand justice.

contents.verseText: Therefore I say, ‘Listen to me; I too will declare what I know.’
contents: Therefore I say, ‘Listen to me;
I too will declare what I know.’

contents.verseText: Indeed, I waited while you spoke; I listened to your reasoning; as you searched for words,
contents: Indeed, I waited while you spoke;
I listened to your reasoning;
as you searched for words,

contents.verseText: I paid you full attention. But no one proved Job wrong; not one of you rebutted his arguments.
contents: I paid you full attention.
But no one proved Job wrong;
not one of you rebutted his arguments.

contents.verseText: So do not claim, ‘We have found wisdom; let God, not man, refute him.’
contents: So do not claim, ‘We have found wisdom;
let God, not man, refute him.’

contents.verseText: But Job has not directed his words against me, and I will not answer him with your arguments.
contents: But Job has not directed his words against me,
and I will not answer him with your arguments.

contents.verseText: Job’s friends are dismayed, with no more to say; words have escaped them.
contents: Job’s friends are dismayed, with no more to say;
words have escaped them.

contents.verseText: Must I wait, now that they are silent, now that they stand and no longer reply?
contents: Must I wait, now that they are silent,
now that they stand and no longer reply?

contents.verseText: I too will answer; yes, I will declare what I know.
contents: I too will answer;
yes, I will declare what I know.

contents.verseText: For I am full of words, and my spirit within me compels me.
contents: For I am full of words,
and my spirit within me compels me.

contents.verseText: Behold, my belly is like unvented wine; it is about to burst like a new wineskin.
contents: Behold, my belly is like unvented wine;
it is about to burst like a new wineskin.

contents.verseText: I must speak and find relief; I must open my lips and respond.
contents: I must speak and find relief;
I must open my lips and respond.

contents.verseText: I will be partial to no one, nor will I flatter any man.
contents: I will be partial to no one,
nor will I flatter any man.

contents.verseText: For I do not know how to flatter, or my Maker would remove me in an instant.
contents: For I do not know how to flatter,
or my Maker would remove me in an instant.

contents.verseText: “But now, O Job, hear my speech, and listen to all my words.
contents: “But now, O Job, hear my speech,
and listen to all my words.

contents.verseText: Behold, I will open my mouth; my address is on the tip of my tongue.
contents: Behold, I will open my mouth;
my address is on the tip of my tongue.

contents.verseText: My words are from an upright heart, and my lips speak sincerely what I know.
contents: My words are from an upright heart,
and my lips speak sincerely what I know.

contents.verseText: The Spirit of God has made me, and the breath of the Almighty gives me life.
contents: The Spirit of God has made me,
and the breath of the Almighty gives me life.

contents.verseText: Refute me if you can; prepare your case and confront me.
contents: Refute me if you can;
prepare your case and confront me.

contents.verseText: I am just like you before God; I was also formed from clay.
contents: I am just like you before God;
I was also formed from clay.

contents.verseText: Surely no fear of me should terrify you; nor will my hand be heavy upon you.
contents: Surely no fear of me should terrify you;
nor will my hand be heavy upon you.

contents.verseText: Surely you have spoken in my hearing, and I have heard these very words:
contents: Surely you have spoken in my hearing,
and I have heard these very words:

contents.verseText: ‘I am pure, without transgression; I am clean, with no iniquity in me.
contents: ‘I am pure, without transgression;
I am clean, with no iniquity in me.

contents.verseText: Yet God finds occasions against me; He counts me as His enemy.
contents: Yet God finds occasions against me;
He counts me as His enemy.

contents.verseText: He puts my feet in the stocks; He watches over all my paths.’
contents: He puts my feet in the stocks;
He watches over all my paths.’

contents.verseText: Behold, you are not right in this matter. I will answer you, for God is greater than man.
contents: Behold, you are not right in this matter.
I will answer you, for God is greater than man.

contents.verseText: Why do you complain to Him that He answers nothing a man asks?
contents: Why do you complain to Him
that He answers nothing a man asks?

footnote.ft: Or that He answers for none of His actions

contents.verseText: For God speaks in one way and in another, yet no one notices.
contents: For God speaks in one way and in another,
yet no one notices.

contents.verseText: In a dream, in a vision in the night, when deep sleep falls upon men as they slumber on their beds,
contents: In a dream,
in a vision in the night,
when deep sleep falls upon men
as they slumber on their beds,

contents.verseText: He opens their ears and terrifies them with warnings
contents: He opens their ears
and terrifies them with warnings

contents.verseText: to turn a man from wrongdoing and keep him from pride,
contents: to turn a man from wrongdoing
and keep him from pride,

contents.verseText: to preserve his soul from the Pit and his life from perishing by the sword.
contents: to preserve his soul from the Pit
and his life from perishing by the sword.

contents.verseText: A man is also chastened on his bed with pain and constant distress in his bones,
contents: A man is also chastened on his bed
with pain and constant distress in his bones,

contents.verseText: so that he detests his bread, and his soul loathes his favorite food.
contents: so that he detests his bread,
and his soul loathes his favorite food.

contents.verseText: His flesh wastes away from sight, and his hidden bones protrude.
contents: His flesh wastes away from sight,
and his hidden bones protrude.

contents.verseText: He draws near to the Pit, and his life to the messengers of death.
contents: He draws near to the Pit,
and his life to the messengers of death.

contents.verseText: Yet if there is a messenger on his side, one mediator in a thousand, to tell a man what is right for him,
contents: Yet if there is a messenger on his side,
one mediator in a thousand,
to tell a man what is right for him,

contents.verseText: to be gracious to him and say, ‘Spare him from going down to the Pit; I have found his ransom,’
contents: to be gracious to him and say,
‘Spare him from going down to the Pit;
I have found his ransom,’

contents.verseText: then his flesh is refreshed like a child’s; he returns to the days of his youth.
contents: then his flesh is refreshed like a child’s;
he returns to the days of his youth.

contents.verseText: He prays to God and finds favor; he sees God’s face and shouts for joy, and God restores His righteousness to that man.
contents: He prays to God and finds favor;
he sees God’s face and shouts for joy,
and God restores His righteousness
to that man.

contents.verseText: Then he sings before men with these words: ‘I have sinned and perverted what was right; yet I did not get what I deserved.
contents: Then he sings before
men
with these words:
‘I have sinned and perverted what was right;
yet I did not get what I deserved.

contents.verseText: He redeemed my soul from going down to the Pit, and I will live to see the light.’
contents: He redeemed my soul from going down to the Pit,
and I will live to see the light.’

contents.verseText: Behold, all these things God does to a man, two or even three times,
contents: Behold, all these things God does to a man,
two or even three times,

contents.verseText: to bring back his soul from the Pit, that he may be enlightened with the light of life.
contents: to bring back his soul from the Pit,
that he may be enlightened with the light of life.

contents.verseText: Pay attention, Job, and listen to me; be silent, and I will speak.
contents: Pay attention, Job, and listen to me;
be silent, and I will speak.

contents.verseText: But if you have something to say, answer me; speak up, for I would like to vindicate you.
contents: But if you have something to say, answer me;
speak up, for I would like to vindicate you.

contents.verseText: But if not, then listen to me; be quiet, and I will teach you wisdom.”
contents: But if not, then listen to me;
be quiet, and I will teach you wisdom.”

contents.verseText: Then Elihu continued:
contents: Then Elihu continued:

contents.verseText: “Hear my words, O wise men; give ear to me, O men of learning.
contents: “Hear my words, O wise men;
give ear to me, O men of learning.

contents.verseText: For the ear tests words as the mouth tastes food.
contents: For the ear tests words
as the mouth tastes food.

contents.verseText: Let us choose for ourselves what is right; let us learn together what is good.
contents: Let us choose for ourselves what is right;
let us learn together what is good.

contents.verseText: For Job has declared, ‘I am righteous, yet God has deprived me of justice.
contents: For Job has declared, ‘I am righteous,
yet God has deprived me of justice.

contents.verseText: Would I lie about my case? My wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.’
contents: Would I lie about my case?
My wound is incurable,
though I am without transgression.’

contents.verseText: What man is like Job, who drinks up derision like water?
contents: What man is like Job,
who drinks up derision like water?

contents.verseText: He keeps company with evildoers and walks with wicked men.
contents: He keeps company with evildoers
and walks with wicked men.

contents.verseText: For he has said, ‘It profits a man nothing that he should delight in God.’
contents: For he has said, ‘It profits a man nothing
that he should delight in God.’

contents.verseText: Therefore listen to me, O men of understanding. Far be it from God to do wrong, and from the Almighty to act unjustly.
contents: Therefore listen to me,
O men of understanding.
Far be it from God to do wrong,
and from the Almighty to act unjustly.

contents.verseText: For according to a man’s deeds He repays him; according to a man’s ways He brings consequences.
contents: For according to a man’s deeds He repays him;
according to a man’s ways He brings consequences.

contents.verseText: Indeed, it is true that God does not act wickedly, and the Almighty does not pervert justice.
contents: Indeed, it is true that God does not act wickedly,
and the Almighty does not pervert justice.

contents.verseText: Who gave Him charge over the earth? Who appointed Him over the whole world?
contents: Who gave Him charge over the earth?
Who appointed Him over the whole world?

contents.verseText: If He were to set His heart to it and withdraw His Spirit and breath,
contents: If He were to set His heart to it
and withdraw His Spirit and breath,

contents.verseText: all flesh would perish together and mankind would return to the dust.
contents: all flesh would perish together
and mankind would return to the dust.

contents.verseText: If you have understanding, hear this; listen to my words.
contents: If you have understanding, hear this;
listen to my words.

contents.verseText: Could one who hates justice govern? Will you condemn the just and mighty One,
contents: Could one who hates justice govern?
Will you condemn the just and mighty One,

contents.verseText: who says to kings, ‘You are worthless!’ and to nobles, ‘You are wicked,’
contents: who says to kings, ‘You are worthless!’
and to nobles, ‘You are wicked,’

contents.verseText: who is not partial to princes and does not favor rich over poor? For they are all the work of His hands.
contents: who is not partial to princes
and does not favor rich over poor?
For they are all the work of His hands.

contents.verseText: They die in an instant, in the middle of the night. The people convulse and pass away; the mighty are removed without human hand.
contents: They die in an instant,
in the middle of the night.
The people convulse and pass away;
the mighty are removed without human hand.

contents.verseText: For His eyes are on the ways of a man, and He sees his every step.
contents: For His eyes are on the ways of a man,
and He sees his every step.

contents.verseText: There is no darkness or deep shadow where the workers of iniquity can hide.
contents: There is no darkness or deep shadow
where the workers of iniquity can hide.

contents.verseText: For God need not examine a man further or have him approach for judgment.
contents: For God need not examine a man further
or have him approach for judgment.

contents.verseText: He shatters the mighty without inquiry and sets up others in their place.
contents: He shatters the mighty without inquiry
and sets up others in their place.

contents.verseText: Therefore, He recognizes their deeds; He overthrows them in the night and they are crushed.
contents: Therefore, He recognizes their deeds;
He overthrows them in the night and they are crushed.

contents.verseText: He strikes them for their wickedness in full view,
contents: He strikes them for their wickedness
in full view,

contents.verseText: because they turned aside from Him and had no regard for any of His ways.
contents: because they turned aside from Him
and had no regard for any of His ways.

contents.verseText: They caused the cry of the poor to come before Him, and He heard the outcry of the afflicted.
contents: They caused the cry of the poor to come before Him,
and He heard the outcry of the afflicted.

contents.verseText: But when He remains silent, who can condemn Him? When He hides His face, who can see Him? Yet He watches over both man and nation,
contents: But when He remains silent, who can condemn Him?
When He hides His face, who can see Him?
Yet He watches over both man and nation,

contents.verseText: that godless men should not rule or lay snares for the people.
contents: that godless men should not rule
or lay snares for the people.

contents.verseText: Suppose someone says to God, ‘I have endured my punishment; I will offend no more.
contents: Suppose someone says to God,
‘I have endured my punishment; I will offend no more.

contents.verseText: Teach me what I cannot see; if I have done wrong, I will not do it again.’
contents: Teach me what I cannot see;
if I have done wrong, I will not do it again.’

contents.verseText: Should God repay you on your own terms when you have disavowed His? You must choose, not I; so tell me what you know.
contents: Should God repay you on your own terms
when you have disavowed His?
You must choose, not I;
so tell me what you know.

contents.verseText: Men of understanding will declare to me, and the wise men who hear me will say:
contents: Men of understanding will declare to me,
and the wise men who hear me will say:

contents.verseText: ‘Job speaks without knowledge; his words lack insight.’
contents: ‘Job speaks without knowledge;
his words lack insight.’

contents.verseText: If only Job were tried to the utmost for answering like a wicked man.
contents: If only Job were tried to the utmost
for answering like a wicked man.

contents.verseText: For he adds rebellion to his sin; he claps his hands among us and multiplies his words against God.”
contents: For he adds rebellion to his sin;
he claps his hands among us
and multiplies his words against God.”

contents.verseText: And Elihu went on to say:
contents: And Elihu went on to say:

contents.verseText: “Do you think this is just? You say, ‘I am more righteous than God.’
contents: “Do you think this is just?
You say, ‘I am more righteous than God.’

contents.verseText: For you ask, ‘What does it profit me, and what benefit do I gain apart from sin?’
contents: For you ask, ‘What does it profit me,
and what benefit do I gain apart from sin?’

contents.verseText: I will reply to you and to your friends as well.
contents: I will reply to you
and to your friends as well.

contents.verseText: Look to the heavens and see; gaze at the clouds high above you.
contents: Look to the heavens and see;
gaze at the clouds high above you.

contents.verseText: If you sin, what do you accomplish against Him? If you multiply your transgressions, what do you do to Him?
contents: If you sin, what do you accomplish against Him?
If you multiply your transgressions, what do you do to Him?

contents.verseText: If you are righteous, what do you give Him, or what does He receive from your hand?
contents: If you are righteous, what do you give Him,
or what does He receive from your hand?

contents.verseText: Your wickedness affects only a man like yourself, and your righteousness only a son of man.
contents: Your wickedness affects only a man like yourself,
and your righteousness only a son of man.

contents.verseText: Men cry out under great oppression; they plead for relief from the arm of the mighty.
contents: Men cry out under great oppression;
they plead for relief from the arm of the mighty.

contents.verseText: But no one asks, ‘Where is God my Maker, who gives us songs in the night,
contents: But no one asks, ‘Where is God my Maker,
who gives us songs in the night,

contents.verseText: who teaches us more than the beasts of the earth and makes us wiser than the birds of the air?’
contents: who teaches us more than the beasts of the earth
and makes us wiser than the birds of the air?’

contents.verseText: There they cry out, but He does not answer, because of the pride of evil men.
contents: There they cry out, but He does not answer,
because of the pride of evil men.

contents.verseText: Surely God does not listen to empty pleas, and the Almighty does not take note of it.
contents: Surely God does not listen to empty pleas,
and the Almighty does not take note of it.

contents.verseText: How much less, then, when you say that you do not see Him, that your case is before Him and you must wait for Him,
contents: How much less, then, when you say that you do not see Him,
that your case is before Him and you must wait for Him,

contents.verseText: and further, that in His anger He has not punished or taken much notice of folly!
contents: and further, that in His anger He has not punished
or taken much notice of folly!

contents.verseText: So Job opens his mouth in vain and multiplies words without knowledge.”
contents: So Job opens his mouth in vain
and multiplies words without knowledge.”

contents.verseText: And Elihu continued:
contents: And Elihu continued:

contents.verseText: “Bear with me a little longer, and I will show you that there is more to be said on God’s behalf.
contents: “Bear with me a little longer, and I will show you
that there is more to be said on God’s behalf.

contents.verseText: I get my knowledge from afar, and I will ascribe justice to my Maker.
contents: I get my knowledge from afar,
and I will ascribe justice to my Maker.

contents.verseText: For truly my words are free of falsehood; one perfect in knowledge is with you.
contents: For truly my words are free of falsehood;
one perfect in knowledge is with you.

contents.verseText: Indeed, God is mighty, but He despises no one; He is mighty in strength of understanding.
contents: Indeed, God is mighty, but He despises no one;
He is mighty in strength of understanding.

contents.verseText: He does not keep the wicked alive, but He grants justice to the afflicted.
contents: He does not keep the wicked alive,
but He grants justice to the afflicted.

contents.verseText: He does not take His eyes off the righteous, but He enthrones them with kings and exalts them forever.
contents: He does not take His eyes off the righteous,
but He enthrones them with kings
and exalts them forever.

contents.verseText: And if men are bound with chains, caught in cords of affliction,
contents: And if men are bound with chains,
caught in cords of affliction,

contents.verseText: then He tells them their deeds and how arrogantly they have transgressed.
contents: then He tells them their deeds
and how arrogantly they have transgressed.

contents.verseText: He opens their ears to correction and commands that they turn from iniquity.
contents: He opens their ears to correction
and commands that they turn from iniquity.

contents.verseText: If they obey and serve Him, then they end their days in prosperity and their years in happiness.
contents: If they obey and serve Him,
then they end their days in prosperity
and their years in happiness.

contents.verseText: But if they do not obey, then they perish by the sword and die without knowledge.
contents: But if they do not obey,
then they perish by the sword

footnote.ft: Or they will cross the river of death

contents: and die without knowledge.

contents.verseText: The godless in heart harbor resentment; even when He binds them, they do not cry for help.
contents: The godless in heart harbor resentment;
even when He binds them, they do not cry for help.

contents.verseText: They die in their youth, among the male shrine prostitutes.
contents: They die in their youth,
among the male shrine prostitutes.

contents.verseText: God rescues the afflicted by their affliction and opens their ears in oppression.
contents: God rescues the afflicted by their affliction
and opens their ears in oppression.

contents.verseText: Indeed, He drew you from the jaws of distress to a spacious and broad place, to a table full of richness.
contents: Indeed, He drew you from the jaws of distress
to a spacious and broad place,
to a table full of richness.

contents.verseText: But now you are laden with the judgment due the wicked; judgment and justice have seized you.
contents: But now you are laden with the judgment due the wicked;
judgment and justice have seized you.

contents.verseText: Be careful that no one lures you with riches; do not let a large bribe lead you astray.
contents: Be careful that no one lures you with riches;
do not let a large bribe lead you astray.

contents.verseText: Can your wealth or all your mighty effort keep you from distress?
contents: Can your wealth
or all your mighty effort
keep you from distress?

contents.verseText: Do not long for the night, when people vanish from their homes.
contents: Do not long for the night,
when people vanish from their homes.

contents.verseText: Be careful not to turn to iniquity, for this you have preferred to affliction.
contents: Be careful not to turn to iniquity,
for this you have preferred to affliction.

contents.verseText: Behold, God is exalted in His power. Who is a teacher like Him?
contents: Behold, God is exalted in His power.
Who is a teacher like Him?

contents.verseText: Who has appointed His way for Him, or told Him, ‘You have done wrong’?
contents: Who has appointed His way for Him,
or told Him, ‘You have done wrong’?

contents.verseText: Remember to magnify His work, which men have praised in song.
contents: Remember to magnify His work,
which men have praised in song.

contents.verseText: All mankind has seen it; men behold it from afar.
contents: All mankind has seen it;
men behold it from afar.

contents.verseText: Indeed, God is great—beyond our knowledge; the number of His years is unsearchable.
contents: Indeed, God is great—beyond our knowledge;
the number of His years is unsearchable.

contents.verseText: For He draws up drops of water which distill the rain from the mist,
contents: For He draws up drops of water
which distill the rain from the mist,

contents.verseText: which the clouds pour out and shower abundantly on mankind.
contents: which the clouds pour out
and shower abundantly on mankind.

contents.verseText: Furthermore, who can understand how the clouds spread out, how the thunder roars from His pavilion?
contents: Furthermore, who can understand how the clouds spread out,
how the thunder roars from His pavilion?

contents.verseText: See how He scatters His lightning around Him and covers the depths of the sea.
contents: See how He scatters His lightning around Him
and covers the depths of the sea.

contents.verseText: For by these He judges the nations and provides food in abundance.
contents: For by these He judges
the nations
and provides food in abundance.

contents.verseText: He fills His hands with lightning and commands it to strike its mark.
contents: He fills His hands with lightning
and commands it to strike its mark.

contents.verseText: The thunder declares His presence; even the cattle regard the rising storm.
contents: The thunder declares His presence;
even the cattle regard the rising storm.

contents.verseText: “At this my heart also pounds and leaps from its place.
contents: “At this my heart also pounds
and leaps from its place.

contents.verseText: Listen closely to the thunder of His voice and the rumbling that comes from His mouth.
contents: Listen closely to the thunder of His voice
and the rumbling that comes from His mouth.

contents.verseText: He unleashes His lightning beneath the whole sky and sends it to the ends of the earth.
contents: He unleashes His lightning beneath the whole sky
and sends it to the ends of the earth.

contents.verseText: Then there comes a roaring sound; He thunders with His majestic voice. He does not restrain the lightning when His voice resounds.
contents: Then there comes a roaring sound;
He thunders with His majestic voice.
He does not restrain the lightning
when His voice resounds.

contents.verseText: God thunders wondrously with His voice; He does great things we cannot comprehend.
contents: God thunders wondrously with His voice;
He does great things we cannot comprehend.

contents.verseText: For He says to the snow, ‘Fall on the earth,’ and to the gentle rain, ‘Pour out a mighty downpour.’
contents: For He says to the snow, ‘Fall on the earth,’
and to the gentle rain, ‘Pour out a mighty downpour.’

contents.verseText: He seals up the hand of every man, so that all men may know His work.
contents: He seals up the hand of every man,
so that all men may know His work.

contents.verseText: The wild animals enter their lairs; they settle down in their dens.
contents: The wild animals enter their lairs;
they settle down in their dens.

contents.verseText: The tempest comes from its chamber, and the cold from the driving north winds.
contents: The tempest comes from its chamber,
and the cold from the driving north winds.

contents.verseText: By the breath of God the ice is formed and the watery expanses are frozen.
contents: By the breath of God the ice is formed
and the watery expanses are frozen.

contents.verseText: He loads the clouds with moisture; He scatters His lightning through them.
contents: He loads the clouds with moisture;
He scatters His lightning through them.

contents.verseText: They swirl about, whirling at His direction, accomplishing all that He commands over the face of all the earth.
contents: They swirl about,
whirling at His direction,
accomplishing all that He commands
over the face of all the earth.

contents.verseText: Whether for punishment or for His land, He accomplishes this in His loving devotion.
contents: Whether for punishment or for His land,
He accomplishes this in His loving devotion.

contents.verseText: Listen to this, O Job; stand still and consider the wonders of God.
contents: Listen to this, O Job;
stand still and consider the wonders of God.

contents.verseText: Do you know how God dispatches the clouds or makes the lightning flash?
contents: Do you know how God dispatches the clouds
or makes the lightning flash?

contents.verseText: Do you understand how the clouds float, those wonders of Him who is perfect in knowledge?
contents: Do you understand how the clouds float,
those wonders of Him who is perfect in knowledge?

contents.verseText: You whose clothes get hot when the land lies hushed under the south wind,
contents: You whose clothes get hot
when the land lies hushed under the south wind,

contents.verseText: can you, like Him, spread out the skies to reflect the heat like a mirror of bronze?
contents: can you, like Him, spread out the skies
to reflect the heat like a mirror of bronze?

contents.verseText: Teach us what we should say to Him; we cannot draw up our case when our faces are in darkness.
contents: Teach us what we should say to Him;
we cannot draw up our case when our faces are in darkness.

contents.verseText: Should He be told that I want to speak? Would a man ask to be swallowed up?
contents: Should He be told that I want to speak?
Would a man ask to be swallowed up

footnote.ft: Or speak without being swallowed up

contents.verseText: Now no one can gaze at the sun when it is bright in the skies after the wind has swept them clean.
contents: Now no one can gaze at the sun
when it is bright in the skies
after the wind has swept them clean.

contents.verseText: Out of the north He comes in golden splendor; awesome majesty surrounds Him.
contents: Out of the north He comes in golden splendor;
awesome majesty surrounds Him.

contents.verseText: The Almighty is beyond our reach; He is exalted in power! In His justice and great righteousness He does not oppress.
contents: The Almighty is beyond our reach;
He is exalted in power!
In His justice and great righteousness
He does not oppress.

contents.verseText: Therefore, men fear Him, for He is not partial to the wise in heart.”
contents: Therefore, men fear Him,
for He is not partial to the wise in heart.”

contents.verseText: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:
contents: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:

contents.verseText: “Who is this who obscures My counsel by words without knowledge?
contents: “Who is this who obscures My counsel
by words without knowledge?

contents.verseText: Now brace yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall inform Me.
contents: Now brace yourself
like a man;
I will question you, and you shall inform Me.

contents.verseText: Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? Tell Me, if you have understanding.
contents: Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth?
Tell Me, if you have understanding.

contents.verseText: Who fixed its measurements? Surely you know! Or who stretched a measuring line across it?
contents: Who fixed its measurements? Surely you know!
Or who stretched a measuring line across it?

contents.verseText: On what were its foundations set, or who laid its cornerstone,
contents: On what were its foundations set,
or who laid its cornerstone,

footnote.ft: Or who set its core in place

contents.verseText: while the morning stars sang together and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
contents: while the morning stars sang together
and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

contents.verseText: Who enclosed the sea behind doors when it burst forth from the womb,
contents: Who enclosed the sea behind doors
when it burst forth from the womb,

contents.verseText: when I made the clouds its garment and thick darkness its blanket,
contents: when I made the clouds its garment
and thick darkness its blanket,

contents.verseText: when I fixed its boundaries and set in place its bars and doors,
contents: when I fixed its boundaries
and set in place its bars and doors,

contents.verseText: and I declared: ‘You may come this far, but no farther; here your proud waves must stop’?
contents: and I declared: ‘You may come this far, but no farther;
here your proud waves must stop’?

contents.verseText: In your days, have you commanded the morning or assigned the dawn its place,
contents: In your days, have you commanded the morning
or assigned the dawn its place,

contents.verseText: that it might spread to the ends of the earth and shake the wicked out of it?
contents: that it might spread to the ends of the earth
and shake the wicked out of it?

contents.verseText: The earth takes shape like clay under a seal; its hills stand out like the folds of a garment.
